metadata.Title: CVE-2018-15587 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: GNOME Evolution through 3.28.2 is prone to OpenPGP signatures being spoofed for arbitrary messages using a specially crafted email that contains a valid signature from the entity to be impersonated as an attachment.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> looks like there are two issues here: #1- evolution shows security bar at bottom of message #2- mail that is not encrypted looks encrypted

criterions.comment: evolution package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.31.90-1').
evolution-data-server package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.31.90-1').
